content.raw:
Currently working in the waypoint-navigation-task branch.

Sketch of how the plugin could work.

### Setup
* The USV starts at a random initial pose (lat/lon).
* A series of waypoints are defined with the associated world file.
* Plugin parses the waypoints and publishes them as GeoPoseStamped messages to topic = /vmrc/task/waypoints 
* Publish with the latch option.
* The geographic (lat/lon) positions are translated into Gazebo coordinates

### Running
During each simulation update: 

* Calculate score (Once the plugin is in "running" state)
    * Calculate the 2D pose error between vehicle and all waypoints (metric should match stationkeeping error calculation; currently sqrt(dx^2+dy^2+W(dhdg^2)) where W is not yet determined).
    * Store minimum 2D pose error achieved for each waypoint
    * Score = average minimum 2D pose error for all waypoints
Note - Assuming it is up to the teams to decide the order with which to traverse the waypoints.
* Publish
    * Current minimum pose error for all waypoints?
Note - will need to convert waypoints (in lat/lon) to Gazebo coordinates
Note - competitors would not have access to pose error during scored runs!
    * score (std_msgs/Float64): Mean minimum 2D pose error
